strings.Value: "Did you really steal that sword from a giant?"
"Does he know that the sword is broken?"
"Remember that evil spirit who haunted the Six Bears? The one we drove away? Well… Don't think I'm crazy! But he visited me in a dream."

"Says, I'm a thief, because I stole his sword. Remember? — That big one, Armag broke it! Also... Says he has all my tribe as hostages. All of them, Nilak too! Says, they will be dead, if I don't return the sword!"
"Well... Oh, no need to lie now. I found it! I lied to everyone I took it in battle — but that giant was dead for a long time! How could I know he would want his old piece of iron back?"
"He knows. I saved the hilt. The ghost tells me to forge a new blade. He even said how to do it. There's a whole ritual!"
"He said — first I have to fix the sword, and then he will tell me where my tribe is."
"I understand. The repair will cost a lot. I never held no such amount in my hands. But... Nilak..." {n}The barbarian shakes her head in grief.{/n}
